Wash & soak the rice for 1 1/2 hours
then grind to a very fine paste
Pour into a vessel add salt and water to make a very thin consistency
this dosa batter should be prepared immediately
heat the dosa tava,apply a little oil and take one big spoonful of batter
spread in a thin,even layer
cover and keep it for a second
then remove it caredully
it comes out thin like a handkerchief
serve with chicken curry or red chutney
Wash and soak fenugreek seeds for 5-6 hours and rice for 2 hours
grind grated coconut and fenugreek seeds along with soaked water
then add rice and grind further to a fine paste
remove and mix it well with salt
keep aside for 8 hours
add jaggery and soda,mix well
keep guri appa tava on fire
apply oil,pour batter to all the rounds and cover it
cook both the sides
guri appa tava-special tava with 7 or 11 depressions
Wash and soak rice for 2 hours
drain completely
grind it to a fine paste with tender coconut,cooked rice and salt
batter should be thicker than neer dosa batter
remove from grinder
keep aside for 8hours
heat the dosa tava,apply little oil
pour a big spoonful of batter and spread it in a circle
cover the tava and cook for 1 minute
remove the lid and take out the dosa
repeat for remaining batter
Soak urad daal for 4-5hours
wash and soak raw rice for 2 hours
wash urad daal and grind to a fine paste
add soaked raw rice and grind to a fine paste
pour to a vessel,add salt and mix well
cover and keep aside for 8 hours
heat the dosa tava,apply oil
pour 1big spoonful of batter and spread in a circle
cook for a minute
repeat the remaining batter
urad daal soaked and kept for 4-5 hours
raw rice washed and soaked for 2 hours
wash soaked urad daal and grind to a fine paste
then add coconut, poha and rice
grind to a fine paste
pour it a vessel,add salt and mix well
batter should be of dropping consistency
cover and keep overnight
aapam should be prepared in deep tava
pour 1 big spoonful of batter
slowly  turn the tava round,so that a thin layer forms on the sides and the middle remains thick
cover and cook till done
the middle part will be fluffy and sides thin and crisp
remove and serve
note- without putting soda or yeast a√†pam can be done
Wash and soak rice and fenugreek seperately for 5-6 hours
wash poha
mix it with curds and fenugreek s√©eds and grind to a fine paste
then add rice and grind further to a fine paste
Remove, mix it well with salt
keep aside for 8-9 hours
keep the dosa tava on the fire and rub little oil
take a big spoonful of batter and spread like urad dosa
cook till done
Mix all the ingredients,add water and mix
batter should not be watery
make dosas
serve them with coconut chutney
wash and soak urad daal and rice separately for 5-6 hours
grind the urad daal till very fine
remove and set aside
then grind the rice fine to sooji consistency
remove and mix well with urad daal paste and salt to taste
1/2 tsp.yeast can be added to the batter
cover and keep it for formenting for 8 hours
greese idli cups with little oil
pour the batter in individual cups and steam for 30 minutes
Wash and soak daal and raw rice separately for 4-5 hours
grind the urad d√†al to a fin√© paste
remove it to a big vessel
grind the soaked rice until b√†tt√©r is fine to a sooji consistency
remove and mix with urad batter,salt and yeast
mix well
cover and keep for for 8 hours
take four jackfruit leaves
keep them edge to edge and attach with fine sticks in the shape of a cup
fill the cups or gunda with idli batter
steam till cooked
the leaves give a nice flavour to the idli
note:moode is also done in the same way
leaves used here are moode voli or long leaves with thorns
the thorns should be removed and the leaf turned round and shaped like a hollow pipe

Incredients: For potato bhaji - 4-6 - medium size potatoes

Steps: to prepare dosa - wash and soak rice and daals seperately in water for 4-5 hours
then grind together to a fine paste
add salt to the batter which should be of dropping consistency
cover and keep aside for 8 hours
apply oil to the masala dosa tava and keep on fire
when hot sprinkle little water on tava
stir batter and pour a spoonful on tava and spread quickly to make a thin flat round
pour little oil on top
cook it till crisp
put a spoonful of potato bhaji and a lump of butter in the centre of the dosa
fold the dosa
serve hot with chutney
to prepare potato bhaji - boil the potatoes
after it cools,peel the skin and smash into small pieces
heat oil,add mustard seeds
when they splutter add sliced onions,turmeric powder,tomato, ginger and curry leaves
mix and cook
add potatoes and salt
mix and cook for 5 minutes
add coriander leaves and turn off the gas

Incredients: 2 cups - jackfruit (without seeds) cut into pieces

Steps: Wash and soak the rice for 2 hours
Grind the rice with jackfruit,coconut and salt to a fine paste
The batter should be thick
Keep the dosa tava on fire
Apply ghee or oil,pour a big spoonful of batter and spread it a little
cook both the sides
Mix all ingredients with little water, make a thick batter
keep tava on fire,apply little oil,take a handful batter and spread to the tava
cook both the sides
Soak rice for 4 hours
Wash and grind it to a fine paste with just enough water and salt
Remove and mix with coconut
Cook this mixture over √† medium flame,stirring continously in a thick bottomed vessel with oil or ghee,till solid enough to be rolled into balls
Make small lemon sized balls
Steam till cooked,(30 minutes)

Grind all the ingredients to a coarse rough paste with a little water.
Season with oil,mustard seeds,urad daal,red chilly and curry leaves.
Fry oil in small pan with mustard seeds,red chillies, crushed garlic and curry leaves
Grind with coconut, salt and tamarind, add little water
Method.Note: Note: Serve with Dosa,Apaam and Idli

Steps: Fry mustard seeds,red chillies, crushed garlic and curry leaves with oil
Grind all the ingredients with tamarind and salt to a rough paste
Peel the skin of raw mango
cut into pieces
grind with the ingredients
Peel the skin of mangoes
cut into pieces
keep in a bowl
Grind the other ingredient and mix it with mango pieces
Heat oil in a Kadai
Fry red chillies,curry leaves and coconut
Grind it with tamarind and salt,don't add water(dry)
put it in a clean bottle
can be stored for many days
cook the chopped ridgegourd gourd skins in a cup of water
drain the water
grind together all the inhredients
Season with oil,mustard seeds,red chilly (broken) and curry leaves
Fry oil and add Mustard Seeds in a pan.
When they splutter add finely chopped Onion, turmeric powder, green chillies, crushed garlic and curry leaves.
When it turns brown, add fine chopped tomatoes (smashed tamrind water if needed), piece of ginger.
Add salt to taste.
Then add 4 Glasses of water and leave it to boil.
After it cooked garnish with chopped coriander leaves.
Grind together the ingredients to a fine paste.
Fry oil in vessel.
Add Mustard seeds when they splutter, add curry leaves then add the ground masala.
Add pinch of Turmeric Powder.
Add salt to taste.
Add red chilly powder, 1 tea spoon of garam masala which gives good aroma.
Leave it to boil.
Garnish with coriander leaves
Grind the ingredients to a fine paste.
Cook 2-3 finally chopped tomatoes with water.
Add salt to taste.
1 Teaspoon turmeric powder.
After the tomato cooked add ground masala and boil for 10-15 minutes.
Add finely chopped coriander leaves.
Season with 1 spoon ghee or oil, mustard, curry leaves, 3-4 flakes of crushed garlic.
Boil the daal in 2-3 cups of water until well cooked,beat it well and keep aside
Boil the tomato with 1 cup water,tamarind and salt until cooked.
add the powdered peppercorns,crushed garlic and turmeric powder and boil
Pour the cooked daal over it and remove
Season with coconut oil,mustard seeds,broken red chilly and curry leaves to a fine paste.
Cook 2-3 finally chopped tomatoes with water.
Add salt to taste.
1 Teaspoon turmeric powder.
After the tomato cooked add ground masala and boil for 10-15 minutes.
Add finely chopped coriander leaves.
Season with 1 spoon ghee or oil, mustard, curry leaves, 3-4 flakes of crushed garlic.

Incredients: 1 cup toordaal washed & soaked in water for 1/2 to 1 hour

Steps: Cook the daal in 3 to 4 cups water until soft
Mix it well
add chopped tomatoes,green chillies,finely chopped ginger, sliced onion,turmeric powder,asafoetida powder and salt to taste
boil until cooked
Add finely chopped coriander leaves.
Season with oil,mustard seeds,curry leaves and broken red chilly

Incredients: For Masala - Ingredients: 1 tbs.Channadaal, 1 tbs.-uraddaal, 1 tsp.-jeera,1/2 tsp.-methi,1cup -coconut grated,1 tbs.- Coriander seeds,8- red chillies,1tbs.-ghee or oil,1tsp.-mustard seeds,10-15- curry leaves

Steps: Keep a Kadai on fire,Fry all the masala ingredients separately with little oil
grind to a rough pastete,add little water
Boil the toor daal with 3-4 cups of water
add the cut vegetables
add salt and cook
add the ground masala and cook for 10-15 minutes
season with ghee or oil,mustard seeds and curry leaves

Incredients: For Masala - Ingredients: 7-8 -red chillies (roasted), 11/2 tbs.coriander seeds(roasted), 1 cup- grated coconut( roasted)

Steps: Grind together the masala ingredients to a coarse paste
Boil the daal in 1 cup of water
Cook the cucumber with onions,tamarind, tomato,salt and asfoetida powder
add the cooked daal to the vegetable mixture
add the ground masala and boil for 10-15 minutes
Season with coconut oil,mustard seeds, broken red chilly and curry leaves
Peel the skin of mangoes and squeeze out the juice from the skin
add it to the mango
put water and cook
add sliced green chillies,onion,chilly powder,salt and jaggery
Season with mustard seeds,crushed garlic flakes,broken chilly and curry leavestep5
Roast all the masala ingredients separately with little oil and powdwr them
Put some water on the mango skins and squeeze out the juice
Mix this with water with mango,roasted powdered masala, jaggery,and salt
cook for 10-15 minutes,stirring contnously
Season with oil,mustard seeds,curry leaves and broken red chilly

Incredients: tamarind -size of 2 limes soaked in water

Steps: Grind together masala ingredients to a fine paste.
Boil the horsegram with 7-8 cups of water,until well cooked.
Drain and take away the residue of the horsegram
Add the ground masala,tamarind water,salt and boil for 15 minutes
Season with oil,mustard seeds,broken red chilly,crushed garlic and curry leaves.
Cook Bengalgram and tendli in just enough water with salt
Grind the masala ingredients together to a fine paste
Then add coconut and grind to a coarse paste
Fry a pan with oil,mustard seeds,sliced onion,crushed 4 flakes of garlic,curry leaves,1spoon urad daal
Fry the ground masala
after its raw smell goes,add cooked Bengalgram & tendli,mix it well
cover the lid and cook for 5 minutes
Note-same type of sukka can be prepared with different combination-Bengalgram & Raw Jackfruit, Bengalgram & Yam
Peel off the outer skin of the plantain stem and cut into round pieces
Then cut each round into small pieces
the loose fibres obtained after each slice is cut should be discarded
boil in very little water with salt till tender
Grind together masala ingredients except coconut to a fine paste
add scraped coconut and grind to a coarse paste
add it to the cooked plantain stem
cook it for 10 to 15 minutes on a slow fire
season with oil,mustard seeds, curry leaves and crushed garlic.
Grind all the masala except coconut to fine paste
add grated coconut and grind to a coarse paste
keep aside
take the flowers and leaves of plantain bud
cut the white part into small pieces and cook
drain the water and keep aside
fry a pan with oil,mustard,sliced onion,1 broken chilly, 4 crushed garlic flakes, 2 sprig curry leaves
add the ground masala, fry till the raw smell goes
add salt and Jaggery
add cooked plantain flower bud,mix it and cook for 5 minutes to a fine paste.
Cook 2-3 finally chopped tomatoes with water.
Add salt to taste.
1 Teaspoon turmeric powder
After the tomato cooked add ground masala and boil for 10-15 minutes.
Add finely chopped coriander leaves.
Season with 1 spoon ghee or oil, mustard, curry leaves, 3-4 flakes of crushed garlic.

Incredients: 1/4 kg raw jackfruit,cut and soaked in salt water

Steps: Grind together maaala ingredients except coconut to a fine paste
add the coconut and grind to a coarse paste
remove and set aside
take out the jackfruit pieces from the salt water
cut into strips and put in fresh water
Heat oil and add mustard seeds
when they splutter add sliced onion,curry leaves and crushed garlic flakes
when onion turns brown add jackfruit slices,add 2 cups of water
boil till it cooked
add the ground masala and salt
cook it for 10-15 minutes
Grind together masala ingredients except coconut to a fine paste
add coconut and grind further to a coarse paste
remove and keep it aside
take out thick outer skin of jackfruit
cut into small pieces and put it in water
remove from water and cook it with enough water,salt and jaggery
when it is cooked drain the remained water
add the ground masala and cook for another 10 minutes
season with coconut oil, mustard seeds,finely chopped onion,curry leaves,urad daal,1 broken red chilly

Incredients: 4-raw bananas(skinned and cut into medium pieces and soaked in water)

Steps: Cook the banana pieces in tamarind water,salt and 2 cups water
grind together the masala ingredients except coconut to a fine paste
then add coconut and grind to a coarse paste
remove and keep aside
Keep oil on fire
add mustard seeds
when they splutter,add curry leaves,broken red chilly
then add ground masala,cook for 10 minutes
drain water from cooked raw banana then add to the masala
mix it,cook for 5 minutes
Keep oil in a pan
add mustard seeds,sliced onion,green chillies,channa daal,turmeric powder and curry leaves
when all well fried,add beans and little water
when beans cooked add salt to taste,grated coconut and mix it well
cook for 5 minutes
Peel the skin of mangoes and squeeze out the juice from the skin
add it to the mango
put water and cook
add sliced green chillies,onion,chilly powder,salt and jaggery
Season with mustard seeds,crushed garlic flakes,broken chilly and curry leavestep5
Roast all the masala ingredients separately with little oil and powdwr them
Put some water on the mango skins and squeeze out the juice
Mix this with water with mango,roasted powdered masala, jaggery,and salt
cook for 10-15 minutes,stirring contnously
Season with oil,mustard seeds,curry leaves and broken red chilly

Incredients: tamarind -size of 2 limes soaked in water

Steps: Grind together masala ingredients to a fine paste.
Boil the horsegram with 7-8 cups of water,until well cooked.
Drain and take away the residue of the horsegram
Add the ground masala,tamarind water,salt and boil for 15 minutes
Season with oil,mustard seeds,broken red chilly,crushed garlic and curry leaves.
Keep oil in a pan
add mustard seeds,sliced onion,green chillies,channa daal,turmeric powder and curry leaves
when all well fried,add beans and little water
when beans cooked add salt to taste,grated coconut and mix it well
cook for 5 minutes
Peel off the skin of Ridgegourd
wash & cut into small pieces
Heat oil on Kadai,add mustard seeds
when they splutter,add sliced onion,green chillies,garlic,curry leaves,mix and add ridgegourd pieces
add salt
add very little water,Cook on slow fire till done
add scraped coconut before removing from fire
Note: Upkari can also be prepared with cabbage,potatoes,French beans,and,snake gourd
